2. Flow - definition and guide¶

  • Abstract Flow
  • Base (Linear) Flow

Flow object deals with scenario, which is represented as some abstract container (in most cases list or graph) with executable objects aka “stages”. All you can do with an instance of Flow object is specify some exact scenario and run it by calling flow.run() method, which is responsible for going through stages of the scenario and executing them.

2.1. Abstract Flow¶

class fuel_ci.flow.base.AbstractFlow[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract flow object

run()[source]¶

Abstract scenario runner

2.2. Base (Linear) Flow¶

class fuel_ci.flow.base.BaseFlow(data, build_dir, scenario=None)[source]¶

Bases: fuel_ci.flow.base.AbstractFlow

Base flow object. Implements linear scenario - all stages are run one after another and result of previous stage is passed to the next one.

__init__(data, build_dir, scenario=None)[source]¶

Constructs new BaseFlow object.

Parameters:
  • data – dict of objects parsed from data YAML
  • build_dir – working directory for build
  • scenario – list of callable stages to execute
set_scenario(stages)[source]¶

Sets scenario (list of stages) to execute in current flow.

Parameters:stages – list of callable stages
add_stage(stage)[source]¶

Appends stage to execute at the end of existing stage list.

Parameters:stages – list of callable stages
run()[source]¶

Runner method which implements linear scenario for stages defined in current flow - all stages are run one after another and result of previous stage is passed to the next one.

Returns:result of the last stage in list
